item.title: Katie add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "In the sunset of dissolution, everything is illuminated by the aura of nostalgia, even the guillotine." -- Milan Kundera

item.title: Katie add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "But the Hebrew word, the word timshel—‘Thou mayest’— that gives a choice. It might be the most important word in the world. That says the way is open. That throws it right back on a man. For if ‘Thou mayest’—it is also true that ‘Thou mayest not." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Katie add a quote by Janet Fitch
item.description: "Nobody ever complained? Girls were kind. No one ever told him, I could barely stay awake. If only you'd come faster, I could have ignored it altogether. Girls were born knowing how destructive the truth could be. They learned to hold it in, tamp it down, like gunpowder in an old fashioned gun. Then it exploded in your face, on a November day in the rain." -- Janet Fitch

item.title: Katie add a quote by Margaret Mitchell
item.description: "Great balls of fire. Don't bother me anymore, and don't call me sugar." -- Margaret Mitchell
